body: Hi all, I have a weird error and am wondering whether anyone saw it before. Running a single hour radiant temp analysis during the nighttime, highly glazed space, subarctic climate gives me the attached output- basically higher radiant temps near the glass than inside of the zone. I don't think this can be- advice on what I might have configured wrongly? Thanks! Max [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/E636THrB2V3-LEskAnYYQ3lX-dui50VzkGq6kHU6cDkApJ4ZfCMEmzbscX7jC6YGiPFljDenu1KObFcWRfT9FxbnDSH28Shz/zone.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/E636THrB2V3t6rTiwVDdpGN2d*9j5tr40i2NjqVkpCHRuBGCQnNEMhcb5pCAW*y9e0rihuOBvlRjjdYjA6MwqElxionyYwLQ/set.JPG)
topic: Radiant Temperature Map °C too high during night
